description:
(over 16s only)
The public is invited to tour Meta’s brand new Kings Cross offices, which house large-scale art installations by Yinka Ilori, Mary Evans and Kyung Hwa Shon. Meta is celebrating the tenth anniversary of its hub in London.

factsheet.heading: Building T: Architectural Description
paragraphs:
Meta’s office at 11-21 Canal Reach is the largest and most significant office development to date for King’s Cross Central Limited Partnership. Designed by Bennetts Associates, the contemporary building with a BREEAM Outstanding rating provides over 400,000 sq ft of modern office space with the interiors concept designed by Gehry Partners and developed and delivered by TP Bennett. With flexible floorplates and outstanding views, it is the largest of the tech company's five offices in London.
The development is divided into four large facets that follow the curve of the site and is topped with an expansive 4,000m² rooftop garden by LDA design offering a biodiverse space to enhance wellbeing for employees. During the early project stages, Meta and the design team worked collaboratively with the landlord and their design team to make bold interventions to the base building.
The building is heavily influenced by the industrial heritage of the extensive railway development on its western boundary. Its distinctive façade features two layers: a cladding of bronzed anodised aluminium panels sits behind bronze anodised aluminium louvres that are perforated. Together, they reflect the building’s scale and emphasise the curved perspectives along Canal Reach in both distant and near views.

factsheet.heading: Building T: Technical Information
paragraphs:
Base build Architect: Bennetts Associates
Base build landscape architect: LDA Design
Fit out architect: Gehry Partners (design) and TP Bennetts (execution)
Address: 11-21 Canal Reach
Area: 430,000sqft 
Environmental certification: In addition to an embodied carbon assessment, the building has been awarded a BREEAM ‘Outstanding’ rating, exceeding its original target. It is also connected to the King’s Cross District Energy Network meaning it will benefit from zero carbon heating, hot water and cooling. The King’s Cross District Energy Network is powered by 100% renewable energy sources.

factsheet.heading: Building T: Cultural Information
paragraphs:
Meta set out to create the space as an ‘experience’ that would let staff and visitors live and breathe the spirit of the organisation. The simplicity of the finishes is reminiscent of academic campus spaces, where the emphasis is on fun, community and the power of a great conversation. Site specific artworks commissioned by Meta Open Arts are located in key spaces throughout the building and play a significant part in creating Meta culture.
Meta Open Arts exists to build community through creativity and as a company dedicated to bringing people closer together, Meta recognizes that creativity is essential to our collective wellbeing. 
Meta Open Arts have commissioned 11 site specific artworks by some of the most exciting established and upcoming artists working in the UK for this building and these will be a focal point for the Open House tours.

factsheet.heading: Building P: Architectural Description
paragraphs:
Designed by AHMM (Allford Hall Monaghan Morris), Meta’s office on Lewis Cubitt Square was created with the wellbeing of its users in mind, while also ensuring future flexibility and adaptability. As well as extensive outdoor terraces, internal spaces have been designed to maximise natural light. Designed as a building with a defined base, middle and crown, the upper floors of the building are set back from the lower section to reduce the overall mass of the building, respect contextual relationships and create a series of generous planted terraces with outstanding views at the building’s fifth floor.
A deep façade of honed, pre-cast concrete elements creates an elevational grid directly influenced by key geometries of the surrounding context. 
Internally, a steel frame supports pre-cast floor slabs that create visual continuity with the external pre-cast concrete ledges. Large floorplates of generous height create flexible working environments and are connected by characterful common parts that are defined through a strategic use of robust linings and exposed concrete elements.

paragraphs:
